author: marvin
msg: Add Timothy Chen to the shepherd's roster.

author: elecharny
msg: o Wait for the UnbindFuture to be completed
o Called the close() methods, which actually shutdown the connection, as requested by RFC 4511 : "

Termination of the LDAP session is typically initiated by the client sending an UnbindRequest ... each protocol peer gracefully terminates the LDAP session by ceasing exchanges at the LDAP message layer, tearing down any SASL layer, tearing down any TLS layer, and closing the transport connection."

author: krosenvold
msg: [MASSEMBLY-395] Fixed primary problem of scope upgrades not being detected
Testcase submitted by Jaan Vajakas, modified slightly by me

author: mamta
msg: DERBY-6764(analyze impact of poodle security alert on Derby client - server ssl support)

Removed SSLv3 and SSLv2Hello from list of enabled protocols on the client and server side to avoid poodle security breach. Also, changed  NaiveTrustManager to use TLS as the default protocol rather than SSL. If NaiveTrustManager used SSL, then it won't find any enabled protocols for SSL after the removal of SSLv3 and SSLv2Hello. Changing it to TLS makes TLS protocols available for communication.
